Should you buy Dead by Daylight?..

In my experience, this game leads the player indiscriminately through a back and fourth cycle of wanting to kill yourself with a butter knife and feeling like the god of this world. 

I personally feel like i put in all the work every match i play and get nothing out of it, while my pathetic teammates do nothing and gain all that i don't.

(Don't play killer at all, it will either develop anger issues in the happiest man or turn you into a mentally deranged victimiser).

if you must play this game, never blame yourself for the loss, after all how could you be in the wrong, everyone else is clearly worse than you.
Me encanta este juego, la trama y sus personajes sin duda lo hacen unico :)

I've been playing this game for a while now and I have to say that YES this is a fun and addicting game, but sometimes there people who will throw the game for some reason. To be honest it's not that annoying but i think if you have even just a couple of friends with this game, it can be really fun. I'd definitely recommend at least trying out. solid 8/10

Really fun to play, lots of different play styles with many characters and perks. Only problem is the rank balancing. It makes it extremely difficult for people who want to start off and are learning the game to actually enjoy the game and makes it hard for even old timers who just don't have certain mechanics down to actually play well against others who mastered techniques and are a much higher rank.
really fun to play with friends
Good game, Like playing with friends but good to play with randoms.  Killers should not have all the advantages.  Most of the time I am bait if I am lower level then other players.

This is a very fun game with lots of action. Intense heart beating out of your chest moments when your running a killer around pallets. Or when you play killer and get into the role of trying to heard players and predict where they are on the map. Which ever role you choose to play you will be able to sink hundreds of hours into trying to learn the small techniques

Compared to most people who would review the game, I don't really have as much playtime as one might expect to really get a feel for a fully multiplayer, asymmetrical experience like this. Most of the meta is beyond me, and my skill (particularly as Survivor) is boilerplate, but not terrible. I can loop a killer once or twice and slam a pallet in their face, I can sometimes mindgame a Survivor into jumping across said pallet right into me, but I also have plenty of games on both sides where things go to shit and I either die first (and in a rather embarrassing manner) or find myself not getting a single proper sacrifice for a whole game because I simply have terrible luck and worse depth perception. 

Overall though, I have fun. Sometimes the toxic shitters get to me, survivors dance and flash their lights at the exit gates, or Killers slap me when I'm on the hook out of spite, but eventually I'll get a matchup against something interesting. Survivors who coordinate, but sloppily, and leave enough wiggle room for me to make some moves. Or maybe it's a killer who makes odd decisions, doesn't tunnel, but also has precise understanding of their killer's kit and impresses me with their plays. And there's always the love I hold in my heart for the "Friendly Killer" games. Looking at you, Deathslinger who escorted us around to do gens and slapped the gate open for us.

The game isn't great. It's honestly as if it's held together with duct tape at times, but I enjoy the slight jank. The silly animations, the a-little-too-loud sounds and odd screams, it's all very charming. Hitboxes seem inconsistent, sometimes simply WEIRD shit happens, but I take quite a bit of joy in it because there's always something memorable about every match (at least for me)

Now, don't get me wrong. The game can ruin itself for you some days. Have a few bad games in a row, find yourself anxious to play Killer or Survivor due to fear of teams who are overly good/bad, it can make your blood pressure go up. Don't play this if you have anger issues and deflect blame often. It'll tear you up.

Overall: Good game! There'll always be problems, and the devs will always be patching their leaky, but afloat ship, and I think that'll be fine. 

PS: Fuck the Doctor I still hate him and his zappy nonsense
